Row.value: This database software has been developed with the cooperation of the UN system. The product has been adapted from UNICEF ChildInfo technology. a1 = UNICEF/HQ02-0222/ NICOLE TOUTOUNJI, a5 = UNICEF/HQ03-0508/ SHEHZAD NOORANI, a6 = UNICEF/HQ02-0208/ NICOLE

DevInfo is a database system endorsed by the United Nations Development Group for monitoring human development. It is a tool for organizing, storing and presenting data in a uniform way to facilitate data sharing at the country level across government dep
Search by sector, goal, theme or indicator name
Search by country, province or district
Web-based data management application to facilitate the tracking progress of development plans.
Customized country profile snapshots on the status of human development worldwide.
Gallery of videos featuring streaming video presentations on human development and evidence-based decision making.
Animated flipbooks created using di Book including Millennium Development Goals Reports and similar publications.
Access the latest human development data on your mobile device
Decision support system for data capture and rapid assessments in emergency situations
Animated dashboards providing consolidated view of multiple human development indicators
Online gallery of presentation objects created using DevInfo technology including colourful tables, graphs and maps.

Structure holds a repository of all such sdmx artifacts which define rules of data - as to how it is structured, Provision Agreements, set of information which describes the way in which Data sets and Metadata sets are provided by a data provider, Provider and Maintenance agency schemes.
Metadata Repository is a repository of all such sdmx artifacts which define rules of metadata - as to how it is structured.
Data/Metadata can be published and data repository registrations are managed here.
Retrieval of Information regarding different types of users in registry and sdmx artifacts for maintaining such information.
List of Providers and their Provision Agreements

Content of first row shall be treated as column header
Data Structure Definition(DSD) defines the dimensions,measures and attributes of a dataset and their valid value set.
DataFlow Definition(DFD) is a subset or view of a DSD which allows some restriction of content.
Concept Scheme is the descriptive information for an arrangement or division of concepts into groups based on characteristics, which the objects have in common.
Codelist is a list from which some statistical concepts (coded concepts) take their values.
Metadata Structure Definition defines the attributes and presentational arrangement of a metadataset and their valid values and content.
MetadataFlow Definition is a subset or view of a MSD which allows some restriction of content.
A maintained collection of Data Providers.

Maintenance Agency Scheme is a collection of maintenance agencies which is a responsible agency for maintaining artifacts such as statistical classifications, glossaries, structural metadata such as Data and Metadata Structure Definitions, Concepts and Co
An organisation that produces data or reference metadata.

Provision Agreement links the Data Provider to the relevant Structure Usage (e.g. Dataflow Definition or Metadataflow Definition) for which the provider supplies data or metadata The agreement may constrain the scope of the data or metadata that can be pr

A user can subscribe to receive notifications - on email or through HTTP Posts - on occurence of certain events on Registry. Depending on the events selected by user for a subscription, the user will receive notification when Data is registered or when Me

Subscription is an activity by which a user can submit a subscription in the registry that defines which events are of interest, and either an email and/or an HTTP address to which a notification of qualifying events will be delivered.
Notification Mail is email address specified by the subscribed user to recieve notification for data/metadata registration by a data provider.
An HTTP Post Notification will be sent to subscribed users at a specified HTTP address announcing all published data that meets the criteria contained in the subscription request.
If Subsciption is done with SOAP protocol then the subscribed users receive Notifications wrapped in SOAP Envelopes.

An Event Selector specifies which type of events are of interest for subscription.There are four types of events for which a user can subscribe. Structural Repository Event - A change in Maintainable artifacts in the Structural Meatadata Repository.Data R

A user can register his data/metadata. The data can be in the form of a file accessible over web i.e. a simple datasource or in the form of a sdmx compliant webservice i.e a queryable data source. Registry validates the data, and on successful validation

Registration is an activity by which a data Provider publishes a new dataset conforming to an existing Dataflow Definition(and hence Data Structure Definition).Similarly data provider can also publish his metadataset conforming to existing MetadataFlow De

Constraint specifies a sub set of the definition of the allowable or actual content of a data or metadata source that can be derived from the Structure that defines code lists and other valid content.
This is the URL of the queryable datasource i.e. SDMX compliant Web Service - hosted by the data provider - whither data and metadata can be queried.
The Rest Protocol attribute indicates, if true, that the queryable data source is accessible via the REST protocol.
WADL URL provides the location of a WADL instance on the internet which describes the REST protocol of the queryable data source.
The SOAP Protocol attribute indicates, if true, that the queryable data source is accessible via the SOAP protocol.
WSDL URL provides the location of a WSDL instance on the internet which describes the queryable data source.
Queryable Data Repository describes a data source that must be able to accept an SDMX-ML Query Message, and respond appropriately.
Simple Data/Metadata Repository describes a data source that is an SDMX-ML data or metadata message. It requires only the URL of the data.
Explore the Request and Response for calling Registry Web Service Functions.
This will send a mail to the admin for granting data provider rights to the user. As a data provider a user can register data/metadata in the registry.

The Catalog section allows users to scroll through the various DevInfo adaptations available online.
Basic information for each adaptation such as the number of geographical areas, time period, and contact information are all provided here. Click on an adaptation to view it online.
Mapping of DevInfo Codes and Concepts against UNSD Codes and Concepts, to help generate SDMX-ML/Metadata Reports from DevInfo database that are compliant against UNSD\'s DSD/MSD.
Mapping of DevInfo against UNSD Codelists

Mapping of DevInfo Codelists' codes against UNSD Codelists' codes. The indicators mapped here govern the number of I-U-S that are shown on IUS Mapping screen. These mappings are also used to preselect values on IUS Mapping screen.
Mapping of DevInfo I-U-S against UNSD Codelists

Mapping of DevInfo I-U-S combinations against UNSD Codelists' codes. This mapping is used to generate SDMX-ML files from DevInfo database that are compliant against UNSD's DSD. The mappings done on Codelist mapping screen are used to pre select values, bu
Mapping of DevInfo against UNSD Metadata Concepts

Mapping of DevInfo Metadata Concept Schemes' concepts against UNSD Metadata Concept Schemes' concepts. This mapping is used to generate Metadata Reports from DevInfo database that are compliant against UNSD's MSD.

Data holds Registrations corresponding to Data Flow Definition, Metadata Flow Definition, Provision Agreement and Data Providers.
Generate SDMX-ML files from databases or in case of uploaded DSDs from associated databases.
Generate Metadata Reports from databases or in case of uploaded DSDs from associated databases.
Line chart is disabled when total number of data values are more than 1000
Column chart is disabled when total number of cells in data grid are greater than 2500
Bar chart is disabled when total number of cells in data grid are greater than 2500
Area chart is disabled when total number of cells in data grid are greater than 2500
Pie chart is disabled when rows count in data grid is more than 100
Map is disabled when area information is not available.
Pyramid is disabled when only one column is available or rows count is greater than 100, in data grid.
Tree Map is disabled when there are more than 100 distinct values for first column of data grid.
Radar is disabled when data columns in grid are lesser than three.
2d Scatter is disabled when data columns are lesser than 2.
Create, Save and Import in CSV format

In order to upload data from an Excel file into DevInfo, it must first be saved as a CSV file. CSV (Comma Separated Value) format simplifies the data entry process for large volumes of data, which are typically disaggregated in numerous ways as well as by
First, enter your data in an Excel spreadsheet using the following format. Note that you can have as many Indicators | Units | Subgroups as you wish.
and select 'Comma Separated Values (.csv).' You are now able to upload your data in the My Data Section
Atleast one field should contain value Notification Mail or Notification HTTP.
Enter value in Subscriber Assigned Id.
Select atleast one Metadata Flow from the list.

Database system endorsed by the United Nations Development Group that enables you to browse, upload, visualize, and share socio-economic data.
